summary: This is an email chain regarding the case US v. Maxwell (20cr330). It forwards a notification from Judge Nathan's chambers granting the parties additional time for supplemental briefing, specifically for CC statements and EX 52. The sender expresses relief at the extension.

persons.name: Nathan
persons.context: Referred to in the context of the email from 'Nathan NYSD Chambers' regarding a court order. Likely refers to Judge Alison J. Nathan.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the email from Judge Nathan's chambers regarding the supplemental briefing extension in US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Listed as a recipient (with designation USANYS) of the email from Judge Nathan's chambers regarding the supplemental briefing extension in US v. Maxwell.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: Identified as the judge whose chambers sent the order granting additional time for supplemental briefing in the case US v. Maxwell.

connections.description: Judge Nathan's chambers communicated a court order extension directly to counsel Pagliuca.
Judge Nathan's chambers communicated a court order extension directly to counsel Menninger.

events.title: Court Grants Briefing Extension
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan granted the parties additional time for two sets of supplemental briefing, specifically for CC statements and EX 52, in the case US v. Maxwell.

keyFacts: The document is an email regarding procedural developments in the criminal case US v. Maxwell (docket 20cr330).
Judge Alison J. Nathan granted an extension for filing supplemental briefing materials, specifically 'CC statements and EX 52'.
The email indicates the order was to be formally docketed on the morning of November 11, 2021.
The initial sender expresses personal relief ('I can finally sleep!') at receiving the extension.
